meanings.definition: A unit of currency in Bulgaria.
meanings.sent1: In Bulgaria, you can buy many things with levs.
meanings.sent2: I exchanged my dollars for levs at the bank.
meanings.sent3: The levs in my wallet were feeling heavy from all the shopping.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a handful of shiny levs, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The sound of levs clinking together is music to my ears.

meanings.definition: The plural form of the word 'lev', referring to the currency in Bulgaria.
meanings.sent1: She counted her levs carefully before paying for the souvenirs.
meanings.sent2: The price of the tickets was displayed in levs at the entrance.
meanings.sent3: The levs in the jar jingled happily as people dropped coins inside.
meanings.sent4: His generosity was like a shower of levs, spreading joy to everyone around.
meanings.sent5: The colorful levs in the market stall caught the eye of every passerby.

meanings.definition: The third person singular form of the verb 'lev', meaning to lift or raise.
meanings.sent1: He always helps others by giving them a lev when they need it.
meanings.sent2: She used all her strength to lev the heavy box onto the shelf.
meanings.sent3: The lev of the curtain revealed a hidden treasure behind it.
meanings.sent4: His words had the power to lev spirits and bring hope to those in despair.
meanings.sent5: With a swift lev of his hand, he caught the falling book before it hit the ground.
